summary: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow for payments to individuals who dye fuel. Specifically, it introduces a new section (6434) that allows the Secretary of the Treasury to pay individuals who remove eligible indelibly dyed diesel fuel or kerosene from a terminal. Conforming amendments are made to several sections of the Code (6206, 6430, 6675), and the amendments take effect 180 days after enactment.
